body.name: Klaire Labs Ther-Biotic Baby - Infant Probiotic Powder - Bifidobacterium Infantis & More - Gut & Immune Support Baby Probiotics - Hypoallergenic - Mix with Breast Milk or Food (120 Servings)
features: A multispecies probiotic to meet the special needs of infants.* Ther-Biotic Baby (formerly Ther-Biotic Infant) packaging may vary as Klaire Labs transitions to SFI Health labeling in 2022.
5 billion CFU blend of five Lactobacillus and five Bifidobacterium species.
Powder can be mixed with expressed breast milk, or solid food at room temperature.*

Hypoallergenic* product free of the following common allergens: milk/casein, eggs, fish, shellfish, tree nuts, peanuts, wheat, gluten, and soybeans. Contains no artificial colors, flavors, or preservatives.
Trusted by healthcare practitioners since 1969, Klaire Labs products are developed closely with physicians and are intended to be used as directed by a healthcare practitioner.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: *These statements have not been evaluated by the FDA. These products are not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease.

Micellized Vitamin D Target B2 Nursing Multivitamin Children's Chewable Probiotic Women's Probiotic Klaire Labs for the Whole Family Vitamin D Drops Breastfeeding Probiotic Premium Nursing Multivitamin High CFU Children's Probiotic 10 species vaginal & UT support probiotic* Designed For: Infants, Children & Adults Breastfeeding Parents Breastfeeding Parents Children (2 years+), Adults & Teens Women (Adults & Teens) Product Features: 400 IU premium vitamin D3 per drop Groundbreaking probiotic supports lactation comfort and infant immune health* A full complement of high quality vitamins and minerals in highly bioavailable, well-tolerated forms* Sweet, natural cherry flavor May help reduce occasional vaginal itching, discomfort, or discharge* Why Choose Klaire Labs? This unique vitamin D product is micellized, which may support superior absorption and utilization by the body* L. fermentum CECT5716 has been shown to decrease discomforts during breastfeeding* Includes 2,000 IU vitamin D and active folate as L-5-MTHF in each serving 8 species which have been intensively researched to support gastrointestinal health and immune function in children* Leveraging the power of probiotic diversity, this solution is designed to adapt to each woman’s unique microbiome with multi-species support.* Hypoallergenic? ✓ Contains: Milk ✓ ✓ ✓

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing! And fast working
reviews.reviewText: This probiotic works amazing. My breastfed baby was not pooping regularly and would go days without having a bowel movement. Like up to a week! Which is supposed to be normal but not comfortable for babies. I tried this probiotic and after the 2nd day he was having regular bowel movements and is so much more happier.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2020
reviews.reviewText: This product was packed with ice but it took so long to arrive that the ice had melted and it was no longer cold. However, I tested it and it was still viable.My breastfed baby was having major blow outs, green acidic stool even after I cut out many known allergens. Within a week of using this, his stool had the right color, consistency and smell. Although it's pricey, it's worth every penny. My baby also has silent reflux. Since starting the probiotic, he doesn't cry as much during feeds and while sleeping.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 25, 2016
reviews.reviewText: I swear by this product!!!!! My 5 week old was only pooping every 3-4 days and had extreme gas problems. Within 4 days, he was pooping every 2 days, and within 2 weeks, he started pooping every single day!! His gas problems have decreased by approximately 75%. I exclusively breastfeed and I don't keep a bland diet at all, so this is really phenomenal.I tried mixing 1/4 tsp with .5oz of breastmilk, but after a few days he wouldn't take it. So then I mixed 1/4 tsp with 1oz, but after a few days of that, he wouldn't swallow it either. Now, I express about 2.5ml of breastmilk into a tiny cup, mix 1/4 tsp into it, and give it to my baby with a syringe. Problem solved!At first I was sitting him upright to give it to him, but that gave him the ability to push it out with his tongue (which he definitely did because it tastes different than just my milk alone). So now I give it to him lying down, putting my hand under his neck to raise his chest slightly so that he can't push it out with his tongue as easily. I squirt tiny tiny bits from the syringe into the back of his mouth, wait for him to swallow, then do it again until it's gone. It's a small amount so it doesn't take long and is TOTALLY worth it! He's even turned it into a game where he sometimes opens up wide, sometimes narrow, and smiles and laughs because he knows I want him to take it!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars 3 yrs of use, tried others, nothing compares
reviews.reviewText: I had two babies that I couldn't breastfeed for longer than 4 months and this has and does help them a lot even today. They are both 2 and 1 now. I don't know what I would've done with out it. A huge boost in their immune system and with digestion. When they get irregular in time, consistency, color, or just need extra support this has saved my and their lives. I've made keifer with it and its only amplified its use and did better for my kids than any formula I tried, homemade or not.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2014
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Far better than most, but make sure it's being shipped with an ice pack!
reviews.reviewText: Ok,My toddler came down with a case of thrush after being given anti-biotics by his pediatrician. He had a nasty ear infection, and this was required; no thought was given to ensuring there was no yeast over growth, which caused thrush and subsequently caused additional sinus issues.After an initial treatment for the thrush, again without any indication that a probiotic was a really good idea, another physician prescribed Ther-Biotic (over the counter) along with Nystatin (prescription only). [The Dr did order a stool sample and blood work to verify there was a residual issue, btw.] The Dr then indicated that he wanted the Ther-Biotic used for at least four months, and that the blend of bacteria in this specific probiotic formulation was better than most in his opinion.First, the stuff is not cheap. However, it does have a pretty high potency, and can be put in something like applesauce and given to your child on and empty stomach 30-45 minutes before a meal, or 3 hours after a meal, with an oral syringe or teaspoon. This is especially important if your child is going on anti-biotics, in which case its usually 3 hours after a meal at least two times daily and perhaps right before bed.Second, the stuff has to be keep in a stable temperature. Some of the vendors on Amazon do not ship this product with an ice pack during the warmer months of the year, and you KNOW that the shipper has plenty of places where it will be extremely hot, etc. It should be in a temperature that is above freezing, below 60 degrees, and consistent.Third, as gross as this may be, you know that this is working when your child has a RUNNY stool. At that point, you should back off the dose by about 25% and the stool should stop being extremely soft or runny.Lastly, the true advantage of this probiotic is it's potency, many stains, and fundamentally low dose compared to the many other options out there. (e.g. I found one in a local supermarket that had most of the same strains, but it turned out you needed almost a tablespoon of the stuff to equal one teaspoon of Ther-Biotic. Clearly can turn out not to be cost effective.)
